definition: lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: Once the belief thease disappeared. i, a word denied all the past.
sentences.chinese: 曾经的信仰灰飞烟灭，一句话否定了所有的过往。

sentences.english: More often than not, your fear will go away once you take action.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你采取行动，恐惧自然就灰飞烟灭了。

sentences.english: Or economists, when all their predictions have just gone up in smoke.
sentences.chinese: 当所有预测都灰飞烟灭时，经济学家们也会这么说。

sentences.english: The original variety of honey Italy, now ashes to ashes.
sentences.chinese: 当初的种种蜜意，现在已经灰飞烟灭。

sentences.english: I don’t want to see you in the ash heap.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想看你灰飞烟灭。
于是我的皮筏漂流梦就这样灰飞烟灭了。

sentences.english: But investor perceptions and confidence can dissolve in a flash.
sentences.chinese: 但是投资商的看法和信心会在一瞬间灰飞烟灭。

sentences.english: But then the financial crisis vaporised hope.
sentences.chinese: 然而，随着金融危机的到来，希望又灰飞烟灭。

sentences.english: Your guidges, resentments , frustrations, and jealousies will finally disappear.
sentences.chinese: 你的幽怨，愤恨，失败，嫉妒，都归于灰飞烟灭。

sentences.english: Trillions of dollars in shareholder wealth have gone up in smoke.
sentences.chinese: 股东手中高达万亿的美元灰飞烟灭。

sentences.english: The remaining prison, the absurd words, together with my ashes to ashes.
sentences.chinese: 剩下画地为牢，这个荒诞的词，与我一起灰飞烟灭。
